page.shortlink: api sql namespace result set object to json object syntax function
page.description: Convert a ResultSet to JSON object syntax.
page.prototype: C toJSONObjectSyntax([ RowsToCopy = -1 as N [, StartRow = -1 as N [, UpperCaseNames = .f. as L [, ConvertToText = .t. as L [, DateTimeFormat = as C [, DateFormat = as C [, ReferenceColumns as SQL::TableInfo [, UserContext as P]]]]]]]])

argument.name: ConvertToText
argument.description: If .T. (default) single-quote numeric and logical values

argument.name: DateTimeFormat
argument.description: Format string for dateTime values, as used by the time Function, e.g. "yyyy-MM-dd"

argument.name: DateFormat
argument.description: Format string for date values, as used by the time Function

argument.name: ReferenceColumns
argument.description: When data is formatted for a column in the result set: (1) if ReferenceColumns has a column with a matching name, that object will be used to format the data; (2) otherwise the ColumnInfo property of the result set is used to format the data.

argument.name: UserContext
argument.description: The user context is passed into the evaluation of the expression when data is formatted.

return.name: json
return.description: Returns a string containing a JSON object.

page.discussion: The toJSONObjectSyntax() method converts an AlphaDAO ResultSet data to a JSON object. This method is more efficient than using the rsToJSON() function.

section.note: To be consistent with the official JSON syntax, values in the generated JSON are double quoted.
